/** The format that the date should be written in string */

* @throws LauraException If dateString is not in the specified format

* A Task with an End date
* @param deadline The date which the Task will end
* @throws LauraException When the date is in an incorrect format
public DeadlineTask(String description, String deadline) throws LauraException {
* @param isDone Whether the task is marked or not

* A Task with a start and end date
* @param from The start date of the Task
* @param to The end date of the Task
* @throws LauraException If any of the dates is in an incorrect format
public EventTask(String description, String from, String to) throws LauraException {
* @param isDone Whether the task is marked or not

* @param to The end date of the Task
* @throws LauraException If any of the dates is in an incorrect format
public EventTask(boolean isDone, String description, String from, String to) throws LauraException {
* Whether the Task is marked or not

* Get the encoded version of the Task for storage on local

// Using valid dates, their encoding should be the same dates
// Using valid dates, their encoding should be the beautified string
// Using invalid dates, a Laura exception should be thrown
// When given a valid date, will return a unmarked task with the written dates
assertEquals("[D][ ] This is a test (by: 13 April 2002)",
assertEquals("[D][ ] This is a test (by: 05 March 2018)",
assertEquals("[D][ ] This is a test (by: 18 December 2000)",
// When given a valid date, will return an unmarked task with the written dates
// When unmarked, mark will mark it
DeadlineTask test = new DeadlineTask("This is a test", "13/04/2002");
assertEquals("[D][ ] This is a test (by: 13 April 2002)", test.toString());
assertEquals("[D][X] This is a test (by: 13 April 2002)", test.toString());
// When marked, unmark will unmark it
DeadlineTask test = new DeadlineTask(true, "This is a test", "13/04/2002");
assertEquals("[D][X] This is a test (by: 13 April 2002)", test.toString());
assertEquals("[D][ ] This is a test (by: 13 April 2002)", test.toString());
// When encode is called, it should provide the correct encoding
// Should provide correct marking when first constructed
// When given a valid date, will return a unmarked task with the written dates
assertEquals("[E][ ] This is a test (from: 13 April 2002 to: 17 May 2002)",
assertEquals("[E][ ] This is a test (from: 13 April 2002 to: 01 February 2025)",
assertEquals("[E][ ] This is a test (from: 17 May 2002 to: 17 August 2025)",
// When given a valid date, will return an unmarked task with the written dates
// When unmarked, mark will mark it
EventTask test = new EventTask("This is a test", "13/04/2002", "15/05/2004");
assertEquals("[E][ ] This is a test (from: 13 April 2002 to: 15 May 2004)", test.toString());
assertEquals("[E][X] This is a test (from: 13 April 2002 to: 15 May 2004)", test.toString());
// When marked, unmark will unmark it
EventTask test = new EventTask(true, "This is a test", "13/04/2002", "15/05/2004");
assertEquals("[E][X] This is a test (from: 13 April 2002 to: 15 May 2004)", test.toString());
assertEquals("[E][ ] This is a test (from: 13 April 2002 to: 15 May 2004)", test.toString());
// When encode is called, it should provide the correct encoding
// Should provide correct marking when first constructed
// When unmarked, mark will mark it
ToDoTask test = new ToDoTask("This is a test");
assertEquals("[T][ ] This is a test", test.toString());
assertEquals("[T][X] This is a test", test.toString());
// When marked, unmark will unmark it
ToDoTask test = new ToDoTask(true, "This is a test");
assertEquals("[T][X] This is a test", test.toString());
assertEquals("[T][ ] This is a test", test.toString());
// When encode is called, it should provide the correct encoding
// Should provide correct marking when first constructed
